dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 686 IH: Protect our Prairies Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Noem (for herself, Mr. Walz, Mr. Fortenberry, Mr. Peterson, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, and Mr. Latta) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to modify the ineligibility requirements for producers that produce an annual crop on native sod, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect our Prairies Act.

subsection.text: Section 508(o) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(o)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A), by striking for benefits under— and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting

clause.text: benefits under section 196 of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7333); and
payments described in subsection (b) or (c) of section 1001 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 1308).

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: During the first 4 crop years of planting on native sod acreage (as described in paragraph (2)) by a producer—

clause.text: paragraph (2) shall apply to 65 percent of the transitional yield of the producer; and
the crop insurance premium subsidy provided for the producer under this subtitle shall be 50 percentage points less than the premium subsidy that would otherwise apply.

subparagraph.text: During the period native sod acreage is covered by this subsection, a producer may not substitute yields for the native sod acreage.

subsection.text: Section 196(a)(4) of the Federal Agriculture Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 (7 U.S.C. 7333(a)(4)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking for benefits under— and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting

subclause.text: a portion of crop insurance premium subsidies under the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1501 et seq.) in accordance with subparagraph (C); and
payments described in subsection (b) or (c) of section 1001 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (7 U.S.C. 1308).

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (C) and inserting the following new subparagraph:

clause.text: During the first 4 crop years of planting on native sod acreage (as described in subparagraph (B)) by a producer—

subclause.text: subparagraph (B) shall apply to 65 percent of the transitional yield of the producer; and

the crop insurance premium subsidy provided for the producer under the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1501 et seq.) shall be 50 percentage points less than the premium subsidy that would otherwise apply.

clause.text: During the period native sod acreage is covered by this paragraph, a producer may not substitute yields for the native sod acreage.

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report that describes the cropland acreage in each county and State, and the change in cropland acreage from the preceding year in each county and State, beginning with calendar year 2000 and including that information for the most recent year for which that information is available.

Not later than January 1, 2014, and each January 1 thereafter through January 1, 2017, the Secretary of Agriculture shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report that describes—

subparagraph.text: the change in cropland acreage from the preceding year in each county and State.
